snippet: A simulator helps train Staten Island Ferry crew members to navigate in New York Harbor.
abstract: Staten Island Ferry crew members practice navigating in New York Harbor by using a simulator; instructor can control weather and visibility, summon tankers or cargo ships into the ferries' path or even disable the navigation system--all with the goal of ensuring that on the real water, a crew will have prepared for every possibility.
lead_paragraph: A simulator helps train Staten Island Ferry crew members to navigate in New York Harbor.

headline.seo: Staten Island Ferry Crew Members Practice Sailing on Land
headline.main: Pilot Lessons for a Ferry, With Water Not Included
headline.print_headline: Pilot Lessons for a Ferry, With Water Not Included
